page.title: 11George Fentham School (Poem)
page.content: As we went into{school,} There was such a noise, Coming from the girls and boys. We went into class, When I heard people yelling. I remembered my spelling {Teacher}t.e.a.c.h.e.r. The teacher came in He looked quite pleased. That nobody teased "Get out your busy books." He told the story of{George Fentham.} George Fentham was clever at work. He built our school _ The story went on _ As we listened to the lecture, From the teacher, We were wondering, When a loud warbler went off. It was playtime when we have a break. We ran around and took a deep breath, As George Fentham was left at death.
